source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Their microstructure consists of elongated $\mathbf { { \alpha } } \mathbf { { \mathrm { z } } } _ { \mathbf { { \bar { \Gamma } } } }$ grains (0.3 to $0 . 5 ~ { \mu } \mathrm { m }$ thick), containing about 1 atom percent niobium, surrounded by a thin (30 to ${ \mathfrak { s o } } \ \mathfrak { n m } ,$ network of metastable $\scriptstyle \mathbf { \beta - Z r }$ phase, containing about 20 atom percent niobium.
composition_raw: about 1 atom percent niobium in α-Zr; about 20 atom percent niobium in β-Zr

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Alloys of Zr-1Nb and Zr-20Nb were prepared, heat treated, and oxidized in $\$ 73\ 8$ water to produce bulk microstructures and oxides that would simulate those normally found on a much finer scale in pressure tubes.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: The nondispersive nature of the implanted hydrogen peaks in the Zr-1Nb oxide after annealing was suggestive of the presence of interconnected porosity in those oxides. However, the broadened peaks in the $\bf { \dot { Z } r } \bf { - } \ \ 2 0 N b$ oxide after annealing are indicative of a normal diffusion process in a nonporous medium.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Pressure tubes in CANDU reactors are made from $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ alloy. The tubes are extruded at about $1 1 0 0 \ \mathbf { K }$ , cold drawn 20 to $30 \%$ , and stress-relieved by autoclaving in $\yen 73$ steam for $^ { 2 4 \mathrm { ~ h ~ } }$ .

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: The resulting microstructure consists of elongated $\mathbf { \alpha } \mathbf { - } \mathbf { \beta } \mathbf { Z r }$ platelets, containing up to 1 atom percent niobium in solution, with an aspect ratio of about 1:5:50 in the radial, transverse, and longitudinal directions, respectively.
composition_raw: up to 1 atom percent niobium in solution
